Message.Title: Instagram to Flickr
Message.Msg: Flickr is chipping away at Instagram's users. Topic.Title: Elusive $20 .

Message.Msg: YHOO user...You get an "at a boy" for telling coldie the truth! Hell no, you get 100 of them!!! I am very long YHOO, but I try to maintain some common sense and understand that we are all here to make money (well some are here for their ego). YHOO goes up and goes down and right now it is up, but at any moment it could turn. I am long but have a hedge against 1/4 of my position. I try to trade the ebb and flow of YHOO and honestly think that once YHOO japan is sold and Alibaba goes public and YHOO sells off that asset, we will have a 38 to 42 tag on this stock. Buy and hold for that would be crazy, so buy or sell and trade once you get the feel for YHOO, you can make money both ways. Shorts have their place, longs have their place, bullshi6ers on the board have their place, which we all know is to rot in hell because they have no other place. If you thinking of buying selling or shorting, welcome to the board and contribute, if you don't own sh^t then you have nothing to say here so move on and take your small life aspirations with you, you do not impress real people. Am I an elitist? Well heck yes, where YHOO is concerned, you either have it want it or have nothing, and you have nothings should just move on to another board. True traders do not need to blow their own horn. While some names on this board are basically good people, they ruin their reps by posting constant over the top posts. That calls into question their intelligence. Look learn undertstand trade and make money, you do not need to do anything else, and if you do, that tells the world how insecure you are and how much you need to hear your words telling yourself how great you are. Negative responders certainly fall into the have nothing catagory! Reveal yourselves!

Topic.Title: Yahoo P/E low at 6.05

Message.Msg: You may be right. Yahoo is at a 52 week high (in fact, almost two year high), so the trend is up, no doubt. But the fundamentals haven't changed. The new CEO was a great move, but this has been a large rally on just the news of a new person in the top seat. Without some specific action or change, I just think the rally is tired. A stock can only rally so much on hope. That's not such an outlandish position, is it? And no alias - I've been posting using the same name for ~a dozen years - hardly an alias. Don't get carried away - I'm not a basher. I just think the rally is a bit over done and due for a bit of a pull back.

Topic.Title: Instagram to Flickr

Message.Msg: Flickr used to be the the king of the mountain when it came to online photo services, and then Yahoo bought it and it sort of lost its way. Fortunately, Flickr has been more of a focus under Marissa Mayer's regime. You might be surprised at just how robust it has become with the new version of the mobile app, where new filters bring it on par with Instagram. Plus, Flickr's approach to photo rights is among the most user-friendly in the industry. You can even choose to license your photos under Creative Commons or sell them through the Getty Images stock photo services if capitalism is your thing.
